TopicTitle: KSP Integrated Dropbox Shared VAB and SPH folders

Articles.Content: For those rocket building companies out there, we'd love the ability to simply connect to a shared VAB and SPH file location via KSP so as we develop ships, they can be automatically updated and shared within KSP between other developers on the fly.

You can set this up yourself -- set up the DropBox folder with SPH and VAB folders, and have it sync with everyone's computer. Then, you can symlink or hard-link the two folders into a savegame's Ships folder in lieu of actually having separate SPH/VAB folders in that savegame. Provided DropBox is running, it should keep everything up to date and KSP will be able to use the files.
I just install KSP in my Dropbox, that way craft files, saves, screenshots and mods all stay synced.

BTSync will do this for you. You can sync any folder between any computer. I use it to keep my entire KSP folder synced between my desktop and laptop.

http://www.bittorrent.com/sync
